It was a cold night. The holiday is normally filled with joy and happiness. But that day was different.

I couldn't help thinking that something wasn't right. And then, suddenly, Mutated Poporis were swarming our farm. The grownups went out and fought. My sister and I were too afraid to help, so we stayed inside.

The villagers didn't stand a chance. There were too many of them. Soon, the mutants got inside the house.Read the next page.

I couldn't move. My sister had to grab my hand and drag me to the back door.
She threw me out the door and told me "Run! Don't look back!"

I did what she said. I didn't look back. I just ran.
But the mutants kept chasing me. I don't remember how long I kept running. I was getting tired and the mutants were getting closer.Read the next page.

Then, just as my legs gave out, it seemed as though the moonlight... shimmered. Almost as though the moon had shattered into pieces. But it wasn't the moon.

A mutant fell down beside me, and before I knew it, they were all dead.

When I recovered my wits, I found a runeglaive, along with a letter, just lying on the ground.

"Just as the moonlight guided my path to you, I hope this runeglaive will help you."

As soon as I read the letter, I knew what I had to do. I grabbed the runeglaive and headed back.
Back to Popolion.
(The next page is torn out.)

Quoted from [Valkyrie Journal], author unknownClose the book.
